perturbation.original_text: Naked shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Wade in the event Wade fails to perform the Wade Services or breaches any other covenant or agreement set forth herein (including the essence of this Agreement), and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: Naked shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon two (2) days prior written notice to Wade in the event Wade fails to perform the Wade Services or breaches any other covenant or agreement set forth herein (including the essence of this Agreement), and fails to cure same (if curable) within one (1) day of receipt of written notice.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice and cure periods to two days and one day, respectively, is unreasonable and may contradict legal standards for fair notice and opportunity to cure in contract law, especially in California. California law typically requires reasonable notice, and such short timeframes could be deemed unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Contract Law - Reasonableness of Notice and Opportunity to Cure

perturbation.original_text: Wade shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Naked in the event of the occurrence of any of the following: (i) Naked is adjudicated as insolvent or declares bankruptcy; or (ii) Naked fails to provide consideration due pursuant to this Agreement, within ten (10) days following the date such consideration is due hereunder (or, if Wade elects to receive stock in lieu of the cash consideration, if Naked fails to instruct its transfer agent to issue the appropriate amount of Common Stock to Wade within ten (10) days following the date such consideration is due in the event such consideration is payable in Common Stock); provided that Naked is notified in writing of such non-payment by Wade and such payment by Naked is not made within three (3) days following such notification; or (iii) Naked breaches any covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: Wade shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon one (1) day prior written notice to Naked in the event of the occurrence of any of the following: (i) Naked is adjudicated as insolvent or declares bankruptcy; or (ii) Naked fails to provide consideration due pursuant to this Agreement, within one (1) day following the date such consideration is due hereunder (or, if Wade elects to receive stock in lieu of the cash consideration, if Naked fails to instruct its transfer agent to issue the appropriate amount of Common Stock to Wade within one (1) day following the date such consideration is due in the event such consideration is payable in Common Stock); provided that Naked is notified in writing of such non-payment by Wade and such payment by Naked is not made within 24 hours following such notification; or (iii) Naked breaches any covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within two (2) days of receipt of written notice.
perturbation.explanation: Decreasing the notice and cure periods for termination to one and two days, respectively, is highly aggressive and likely violates principles of fair dealing and commercial reasonableness. Such short timeframes severely limit Naked's ability to respond to or rectify breaches, potentially conflicting with legal standards for contract enforcement and good faith, especially under New York law which governs this agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York Contract Law - Good Faith and Commercial Reasonableness
